summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, providing notice of the government's intent to offer testimony from an FBI Computer Forensic Examiner regarding the extraction of data from devices seized via search warrants. The letter also reiterates requests for reciprocal discovery and expert witness notice from the defense.

events.title: Government Expert Witness Notice
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides formal notice of its intent to call an FBI Computer Forensic Examiner to testify about data extraction from devices seized in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Initial Discovery Request
events.description: The Government made its initial request for reciprocal discovery from the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Initial Expert Notice Request
events.description: The Government made its initial request for reciprocal notice regarding any expert witnesses the defense intends to call.

keyFacts: The government plans to call an FBI Computer Forensic Examiner to testify about extracting data from devices seized via search warrants in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The examiner's testimony will cover user information, documents, and photographs extracted from the devices, and some devices were clones of extractions performed by someone else.
The government is reiterating requests for reciprocal discovery and expert witness notices from Maxwell's defense team, originally made in August 2020 and April 2021.
The document is a formal legal notice from the U.S. Attorney's Office, indicating the pre-trial phase of the case and the government's preparation of digital evidence.
